item.title: Hexagon Grid
item.dc:creator: Eric Williams
item.description: Initial layout code for hexagon grid building and size calculations. There are a few variables in scss that can be the focus to change the grid but I’m not sure that scss, or whatever type the variable is, can be modified directly. It’s likely that all calculations done in scss must be moved over to javascript.

item.title: Masonry Grid Calculated
item.dc:creator: Eric Williams
item.description: The masonry grid now adjusts column and row count and span resolution on window resize so all the images fit and scale nicely while maintaining square grid spans. Apparently Chrome and Edge have some overlap issues and code may need some adjustments. Maybe try grid auto rows instead of grid template rows? Problem solved by removing grid from the list item, so no layout type flex or grid, and adding list-style-type: none to remove list bullets. Sample code can be found here: gist link maybe?
